Welcome to Tribool’s documentation!¶

class tribool.Tribool(value=None)¶

Tribool representing three logical states.

Tribool represents True, False, or Indeterminate using a private value set to True, False, or None respectively.

__and__(that)¶

Logical AND of Tribool and other value.

__eq__(that)¶

Logical equality of Tribool and other value.

__ge__(that)¶

Logical greater than or equal of Tribool and other value.

__gt__(that)¶

Logical greater than of Tribool and other value.

__index__()¶

Raise ValueError on conversion to int.

__init__(value=None)¶

Intialize Tribool object.

Tribool(value) – value may be one of True, False, None, or Tribool.

None is representative of an indeterminate boolean value.

__invert__()¶

Logical negation of Tribool value.

__le__(that)¶

Logical less than or equal of Tribool and other value.

__lt__(that)¶

Logical less than of Tribool and other value.

__ne__(that)¶

Logical inequality of Tribool and other value.

__nonzero__()¶

Raise ValueError on conversion to bool.

When this occurs, it may indicate that the logical operators: (and, or, not) were used. Python does not permit overloading these operators. Use the bitwise (&, |, ^) operators instead. Likewise, if the comparison operators (<, <=, >, >=) were used then a type conversion using Tribool(...) is required.

__or__(that)¶

Logical OR of Tribool and other value.

__rand__(that)¶

Logical AND of Tribool and other value.

__repr__()¶

String representation of Tribool state.

__ror__(that)¶

Logical OR of Tribool and other value.

__rxor__(that)¶

Logical XOR of Tribool and other value.

__str__()¶

String representing Tribool value.

__trunc__()¶

Raise ValueError on truncation.

__xor__(that)¶

Logical XOR of Tribool and other value.
